item.title: How much carbon is stored in one trillion trees?
item.description: The short answer: About 5.7 times as much than is currently stored in forests in the lower 48 US states and Alaska. One trillion trees equates to about 101 billion metric tons of carbon stored. The Trillion Trees Campaign has been widespread in the news recently.
